cs691.assignment04

Class ClusterEnsemble

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs691.assignment04.ClusterEnsemble
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClusteringMethod

    public class ClusterEnsemble
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClusteringMethod
    This class encapsulates the RP+EM algorithm described by the paper found at http://www.aaai.org/Papers/ICML/2003/ICML03-027.pdf .
    Author:
    sloscal1

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int numEnsembleMembers
      The number of clustering algorithms to use in the ensemble
      private int numFinalClusters
      The consensus number of clusters to use in the end
      private double percentNoiseThreshold
      The noise threshold used in the HierarchicalClustering phase of the algorithm
      private int randomProjectionsSeed
      The seed value for the random projections (set to ensure experimental repeatability)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClusterEnsemble

        public ClusterEnsemble(int numEnsembleMembers,
                       int numFinalClusters,
                       double percentNoiseThreshold)
        Construct a new ClusterEnsemble method which implements the algorithm described in http://www.aaai.org/Papers/ICML/2003/ICML03-027.pdf .
        Parameters:
        numEnsembleMembers - the size of the ensemble (number of Random Projections to use)
        numFinalClusters - the number of clusters to be returned by the Hierarchical Clusterer
        percentNoiseThreshold - the percentage (0 - 100) of points to consider noise and exclude from the Hierarchical Clustering process.

    • Method Detail

      • doMultipleRandomProjections

        public PairwiseStorage doMultipleRandomProjections(weka.core.Instances data,
                                                   int n)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        This method follows the procedure described on the left column of page 3 of http://www.aaai.org/Papers/ICML/2003/ICML03-027.pdf . It will produce a number of clusterings (each done on a different random projection of the data) and will use those clustering results to determine pairwise instance similarity based on how likely it is that two points appear together in many different clustering results.
        Parameters:
        data - non-null data with no class label!
        n - the number of random projections to execute
        Returns:
        an object containing the pairwise similarity values for all pairs i,j of Instances in data according to the procedure described in the linked paper above.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - will occur if something is wrong with the data - don't worry about properly handling it

      • getBestClusterer

        public weka.clusterers.EM getBestClusterer(weka.core.Instances data)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This method determines the appropriate number of clusters to use in an EM algorithm by finding the number of clusters where BIC is maximized.
        Parameters:
        data - must not be null
        Returns:
        the EM object that achieves the best BIC.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - don't worry about these - it shouldn't happen if the input data is correct and you did everything right.

      • mergeClusters

        public java.util.List<java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> mergeClusters(weka.core.Instances data,
                                                                      PairwiseStorage simValues,
                                                                      int desiredResultingClusters)
                                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Conduct a hierarchical clustering on the data points using the simValues to inform distance as described on the right column of page 3 in http://www.aaai.org/Papers/ICML/2003/ICML03-027.pdf .
        Parameters:
        data - non-null data
        simValues - the previously computed similarity values (called P in the paper)
        desiredResultingClusters - the number of clusters to return from the hierarchical clustering process
        Returns:
        The clustering found by the HierarchicalClustering process
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - don't worry about proper handling of errors here

      • getClusters

        public java.util.List<java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> getClusters(weka.core.Instances data,
                                                                    int run)
                                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ClusteringMethod
        The overall method to call from Experiment that follows the specific procedure in each of the implementing classes to get the clustering result given specific data and which run is being executed.
        Specified by:
        getClusters in interface ClusteringMethod
        Parameters:
        data - must not be null
        run - (so far used to seed a random value)
        Returns:
        clustering result as used throughout this work
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - don't worry about properly handling these - if everything works and the input data is valid no exceptions should be thrown.
